column4: whenever i try to enable Beryl, the windows go away, then come back and metacity is enabled (as the fallback)

i was trying to
have you checked the logs in /var/log/* '

i'd check messages, daemon and the Xorg log (the xorg log may be in /etc/X11)
but first, i'd check if there is a special log for beryl (google for it ...)
NTFS write is already included in the edgy, use ntfs-3g

hmmm ... i lost how fon'ts work... there were some huge changes since 1997 .. but you might google for that nice fonts mini howto :)
the problem is, if you have wine installed it will actually come up on your ubuntu box (regedit that is)
home sweet home ... you are not even missing the transparency and ease of use a tool like regedit gives us all on your linux box. now that's sweet, isn't it ? :D

bad ram, goofy drivers, corrupt registry ... funny services ... there are plenty of possibilities and no usable logs .... good luck troubleshooting
